body: LEAD: Bay Ridge, in my memory, is where my grandfather drove the Borden's Milk wagon up to the house every morning to get his breakfast, in the middle of his route. He came into the house on Sixth Avenue, and my grandmother gave him eggs and sausages and bakery rolls for the drippings, and the white horse ate from the oat bag tied around his nose.
title: NEIGHBORHOOD VIGNETTES FROM & NEW YORKERS; FLASHBACKS: Back to Bay Ridge

body: LEAD: A Long Island waste disposal company was convicted yesterday of falsely contending it burned 1,400 bags of infectious medical waste that were later found in a Brooklyn warehouse, but the judge set aside the jury's verdict, according to the Brooklyn District Attorney. title: Judge Rejects Waste Verdict

body: LEAD: ARTISTS priced out of the market for lofts in Manhattan have long sought refuge from high rents by taking space in the city's other boroughs. But in the last few years some of them have found that the push to revitalize industrial neighborhoods close to Manhattan has also pushed up the prices of loft space there, too. ARTISTS priced out of
title: REAL ESTATE; Co-op Space For Artists In Brooklyn

body: LEAD: ''THIS is a neighborhood,'' said Alexandra Corbin describing Carroll Gardens, ''where an investment banker can move in next to a plumber and a sanitation worker, and everybody becomes friends.'' body: LEAD: Imperial City New York By Geoffrey Moorhouse 320 pages. Henry Holt. $21.95. Imperial City New York By Geoffrey Moorhouse 320 pages. Henry Holt. $21.95. Power breakfasts. Loft conversions. title: Books of The Times; New York Seen Through an Englishman's Eyes

body: LEAD: A 19-year-old Brooklyn woman was charged yesterday in the death of her infant daughter, who died Tuesday after being in a coma for 12 days, the police said. The woman, Sandra Jenkins, of 198 Bond Street in the Gowanus Houses, a housing project in the Boerum Hill section, was charged with second-degree murder in the death of her 8-month-old
title: Baby Dies; Mother Charged

body: LEAD: A two-car crash killed two people yesterday on the Gowanus Expressway in Brooklyn, leading to a second pileup when a motorist suspected of being a drunken driver smashed into an ambulance heading to the scene, the police said. title: 2 Killed in Expressway Crash in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: As flames billowed from a disabled propane tank truck on Long Island for a second day yesterday, the traffic jams the accident created symbolized a chaotic day for commuters in the New York metropolitan region. title: Commuter Chaos: Accidents and Rain

body: LEAD: 'Graduate' and 'Godspell' 'Graduate' and 'Godspell' Hope springs eternal, and why not? Two more musicals, both with famous names, are in the offing. One, brand new, is planned for Broadway by year's end. The other, an updated revival, is scheduled for Off Broadway, probably by early summer. The Broadway entry will be ''The Graduate,''
title: On Stage

body: LEAD: THE next time someone tries to sell you a bridge in New York City, be sure to ask for a warranty. Officials say about half the city's bridges are rated in poor or fair condition, 31 have had to be at least partly closed off and 100 need to be replaced. THE next time someone tries to sell you a bridge in New York City, be sure to ask for a
title: THE REGION; NEW YORK'S BRIDGES ARE CRUMBLING TOWERS OF NEGLECT

body: LEAD: A city fleet of tow trucks will offer free gasoline, jump starts and tows to motorists on Staten Island highways in a test beginning Monday. title: City Tow Trucks Will Help Drivers on 4 S.I. Highways

body: LEAD: Cocaine abuse and AIDS are taking the lives of children born in the most devastated neighborhoods of New York City, nudging up the city's infant mortality rate after more than a decade of decline and sowing fears of steeper increases to come.
